title: Ellenor McIntosh makes Forbes 30 under 30 list.
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"She is known for driving the success of Twipes - the first ‘truly flushable’ wet wipe."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":""}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":""}]}]
author: Anonymous

title: The koala is on the brink of extinction
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"WWF-Australia warns that the koala is on the brink of extinction, after drought, fires and land-clearing."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":""}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":""}]}]
address: Level 1/1 Smail St, Ultimo NSW 2007, Australia
author: Anonymous

title: Renewable energy has become the UK’s main source of power for the first time ever.
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"A quarterly update from EnAppSys confirms renewables delivered nearly 45% of UK power during the first part of 2020."}]}]
author: Florence

title: Arizona is sinking.
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"A combination of groundwater pumping and high temperatures is shrinking aquifers and lowering water tables in Arizona. Fissures are beginning to open, swallowing livestock and infrastructure as the land sinks."}]}]
author: Anonymous

title: Test
content: Test from Harry
author: Harry

title: Amsterdam embraces the ‘doughnut’ model of economics following the coronavirus pandemic
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The ‘doughnut model’ was first suggested by Kate Raworth and centres on thriving in balance with the planet."}]}]
author: Anonymous

title: The University of Helsinki is divesting from fossil fuels
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"It intends to do so before the end of 2020."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":""}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":""}]}]
author: Anonymous

title: Baishazhou wet market has reopened
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Baishazhou wet market, one of the biggest in Wuhan, is already buzzing again after lockdown is lifted in the city where coronavirus first emerged."}]}]
address: Baishazhou, Wuchang District, Wuhan, Hubei China
author: Harry

title: The Himalayas are visible from parts of India
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Some estimate it's the first time in 30 years they've been seen clearly from Punjab."}]}]
author: Anonymous

title: New York State passes legislation enabling new clean power plans
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"It will have its own ‘Green New Deal’"}]}]
author: Anonymous

title: The previously dormant Keystone XL tar sands oil pipeline springs back into action
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Protestors have been sidelined by social distancing and the province of Alberta has announced over $5 billion in funding."}]}]
address: 450 - 1 Street S.W. Calgary, AB, Canada, T2P 5H1
author: Harry

title: Many British homes will be paid to use electricity during the day for the first time ever
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"These ‘negative electricity prices’ have come about because of new wind and solar projects, alongside favourable weather conditions, leading to a surge in clean energy during lockdown."}]}]
author: Harry

title: Locust swarms are gathering in East Africa
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Kenya, Somalia and Ethiopia are the hardest hit. Coronavirus is preventing the delivery of pesticides. Locust numbers increased massively last year, because of unusual weather patterns amplified by climate change, and now crops look set to be devastated by their impact."}]}]
author: Anonymous

title: Stay Grounded campaign launches
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Stay Grounded are encouraging governments to impose red lines when giving out aviation bailouts. They demand: people first; a just transition towards climate-safe mobility; and no bailouts if the companies do not pay their taxes."}]}]
author: Florence

title: India’s government has announced funding for solar power
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The funding will enable 2 million farmers to invest in solar-powered irrigation pumps. They’ll be connected to the grid but when not needed can help farmers make a living selling clean electricity."}]}]
author: Tom

title: There has been a crude oil spill in the Amazon region of Ecuador.
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Pipeline bursts have caused oil to enter the Coca river, affecting the local indigenous population especially."}]}]
author: Tom

title: Amazon fires employee activists
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The company has recently fired user experience designers Emily Cunningham and Maren Costa, who have been outspoken about climate change and petitioned for better warehouse conditions."}]}]
author: Harry

title: Renault announces it will sell only electric cars in China
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The company will stop making and selling gas-powered cars in China, producing multiple electric vehicles through three different ventures instead."}]}]
author: Anonymous

title: Work begins to protect the Hawksbill turtle
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The population of Hawksbill turtles has declined around 80% in the last century and a half. Turtle hatchlings often get confused by electric lighting, walking into oncoming traffic instead of towards the sea. They also have to navigate plastic pollution and the threat of predators. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Luis Antonio Góngora Dominguez, with a team of volunteers, will spend April to October on the beaches of Seybaplaya facilitating turtle nesting season and helping hatchlings reach the water."}]}]
author: Anonymous

title: Protected mangroves to be destroyed to make way for $8bn  oil refinery
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"AMLO asks state-owned oil company Pemex to raze mangroves to make way for refinery. Mangroves are crucial to the area's ecosystems – they absorb carbon dioxide long-term and filter polluted seawater."}]}]
author: Anonymous

title: Extinction Rebellion's #PaintTheStreets campaign begins
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The #PaintTheStreets rewilding campaign has started. Extinction Rebellion are continuing their activism in lockdown, focusing on regenerative activities – rewilding homes and streets with plants and arts."}]}]
author: Anonymous

title: IPES-Food share coronavirus learnings
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The International Panel of Experts on Sustainable Food Systems have outlined their ideas on how we shape food systems to support human and planetary health moving forwards. The full report can be found on their website, but relevant takeaways include: – resilience at all levels - ending habitat loss via industrial agriculture - local food chains and nutritious food for all"}]}]
author: Anonymous

title: AU$ 300 million for coral research
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Several experiments aimed towards supporting the Great Barrier Reef in the face of climate change are due to receive hundreds of millions in public and private funds over the next five years."}]}]
author: Anonymous

title: Aquiu, grocery store and climate change community centre, delivers locally-grown food in lockdown
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Before lockdown, the epicerie hosted zero waste workshops, bike repair classes, and activist round tables. Now, the brother-sister duo who run it are focusing their energies on a new ‘surprise panier’ service. People can order a crate filled with local, seasonal fruits and vegetables for pick-up or delivery."}]}]
author: Ciara

title: World's largest online climate conference ever will mark 50th anniversary of Earth Day
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The conference, featuring over 100 speakers, will run daily from 20th to 25th April. Partners behind the conference include representatives from the UN, governments, think tanks, campaigners, businesses and so on."}]}]
author: Anonymous

title: Ministry of Climate Change takes over Marghazar Zoo
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Previously, the Metropolitan Corporation Islamabad were responsible for the zoo. State Minister for Climate Change told a parliamentary body last year that the zoo was in awful condition, with exotic animals dying due to a lack of trained caretakers. She also alleged caretakers took home feed meant for animals."}]}]
author: Anonymous

title: Climate groups from across Africa denounce funding of an 'exceptionally high-risk' pipeline
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"A petition has launched to the United Nations, to enshrine access to nature as a human right: "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"www.change.org/natureisahumanright "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Alongside recognised rights – such as access to work, leisure and education – access to a natural environment is fundamental to human health and happiness. A growing body of research proves the necessity of time spent in nature, with just 2 hours a week providing equivalent mental and physical benefits to getting enough exercise. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Currently, however, global urbanisation is leading to nature deprivation and environmental inequality. Hundreds of millions of people are currently at risk of the adverse effects of nature impoverishment. This inequality demands action for social justice. We can protect present and future generations by designating access to nature as a human right. Sign and share the petition today."}]}]
address: African Development Bank, Abidjan, Ivory Coast
author: Anonymous

title: Making Access to Nature a Human Right
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Earth Minutes is an environmental platform that communicates research effectively through using creativity and optimism. Aiming to empower long-term environmental change through building a community of positive environmentalists. Recently, we’ve launched the Easter Insta Takeover, including inspiring workshops, lessons and talks!"}]}]

content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Earth Minutes is an environmental platform that communicates research effectively through using creativity and optimism. Aiming to empower long-term environmental change through building a community of positive environmentalists. Recently, we’ve launched the Easter Insta Takeover, including inspiring workshops, lessons and talks!"}]}]

title: The University of Alaska has recommended eliminating the Atmospheric Sciences programme
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The Board of Regents will make its final decision on June 5th. A programme in the Arctic is obviously key to studying Arctic processes; the next farthest north programme in NA is in Winnipeg, Manitoba (source: Brian Brettschneider, @Climatologist49)."}]}]
author: Anonymous

title: African Development Bank strongly rebuts claims it plans to provide financial support to the East African Crude Oil Pipeline
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"According to a recent press release, these are the facts: "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"1. No financing to any Private Sector Company for upstream oil or gas pipeline projects in East Africa from NEPAD-IPPF. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"2. No commitment therefore made to fund the East African Crude Oil Pipeline Project. The project is not included in the Bank’s lending program."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"3. The Bank is strongly committed to renewable energies. Last week we reported on the letter that was allegedly sent by leaders of environmental groups from around Africa."}]}]
address: African Development Bank, Abidjan, Ivory Coast
author: Anonymous

title: Live panel: Activism within Academia
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Professors, graduate and undergraduate students from Lund University in Sweden share views and tips on activism within academia in the age of the climate and ecological emergency. All welcome to join via the link below. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"-- LIVE BROADCAST at 16:00 on Monday the 20th! -- "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"In light of the ongoing climate emergency and mass extinction, members of society are increasingly taking to public activism. In parallel, universities around the globe are urged to advance their sustainability commitments and take a leading role in the transition to a sustainable society. In this event, a panel of students and researchers will explore the concept of activism within academia. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"In the time of a global emergency, what can or should researchers and students do in order to bring about change - at their universities, in the lecture hall, and through their research and studies? What could activism within academia entail? Does it, can, or should it exist? If so, in what shape? "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Panel: Steven Curtis - PhD student, IIIEE Martin Jarenmark - Research engineer, Department of Geology Milan Loose - Master student, IIIEE Kimberly Nicholas - Associate Professor, LUCSUS Lisa Quartey - Bachelor student, Centre for Languages and Literature Josefine Sarkez - PhD student, Division of Ethnology "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Where? The panel discussion will be live-streamed in this event. You can also join us on Zoom: "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"https://lu-se.zoom.us/j/393993453. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Organizers: Josefine Henman and Wilhelm Wanecek, together with Intersection "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Event info/live streaming: "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"https://www.facebook.com/events/622095911855937/?active_tab=about"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":""}]}]
author: Kimberly Nicholas

title: Senda Verde animal sanctuary urgently seek donations
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"La Senda Verde fight wildlife crime through education and take care of rescued animals. In quarantine, they are receiving no income from admissions. More than 800 animals need help. You can donate at sendaverde.org."}]}]
author: Anonymous

title: Inti Wara Yassi, who rescue animals from illegal trafficking, seek donations
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Inti Wara Yassi are lacking volunteers because of covid-19. They need donations to feed more than 500 animals across 3 wildlife centres. You can donate at intiwarayassi.org."}]}]
author: Anonymous

title: Green Energy Investment North of the Tyne
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"At the end of March 2020, the North of Tyne Combined Authority announced that over the next eight years, £25 million will be invested in the offshore wind industry. The North of Tyne area covers the local authorities of Newcastle, Northumberland and North Tyneside. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Deputy mayor, Norma Redfearn, said that the “work to tackle climate change and grow the green economy will be critical to the success of the North of Tyne region and help us deliver prosperity for our people.\" "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Other projects relating to the climate crisis include an environmental education initiative and a Citizens’ Assembly on climate change. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"More information can be found on the North of Tyne CA website: "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"https://www.northoftyne-ca.gov.uk/news/2020/3/25/greenrecovery"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":""}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":""}]}]
address: North of Tyne Combined Authority, Quadrant West, 2 Quicksilver Way, Cobalt Business Park, Newcastle upon Tyne, NE27 0QQ
author: Ellie

title: Climate Change Social Photography
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"wEarthWhile seeks to reconnect humanity back to Earth by addressing the issues facing the environment and, consequently, those in it. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Work in the humanities is a real path for change because political marketing doesn’t appeal to people’s emotions the way that art and stories do. And it seems like getting people to connect to their own humanity and feelings is essential to our ability to connect and have compassion for others. We don’t want to distract, overwhelm, or create burden by adding more to social media with the endless stories surrounding the social sphere; the intention is to replace the focus back on the faces of the change. We don’t expect to approach society as what we think we want them to think, but instead what we want them to do and let them form what they should do. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"This is an intergenerational fight. We don’t want to have reform that will end climate change and environmental struggles by 80%. We want 100% improvement. To humanize the lives of climate change. To put a face to its impacts. To shine a light on the mostly unseen. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Social photography … let there be light. WearthWhile embodies social photography to shine a light on stories that aren’t accessible to the public. Our aim is to create a tool that primes for a social reform or even a revolutionary movement. To be a part of that transition to fundamentally change how society views climate change and what is being done about it. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The photoblog platform establishes positive and progressive discussion; at the heart of that is to include and recognize that people have feelings, experiences, beliefs and inner conflicts that influence the way they perceive and assimilate information. The internet offers opportunities for greater transparency and public participation into our changing climate. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"WearthWhile is a photoblog [story platform] that gives back the voice to the people. The commitment through this organization is to put emphasis on the opinions, impacts and experiences of people dealing with climate change and environmental problems. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Narrative offers a powerful means to engage an audience and convey complex concepts. Stories employ the elements of successful narratives, including personalizing their story, drawing on emotions and expressing their opinions. Dialogue rather than a debate offers the means to identify common purpose and foster constructive, evidence-based discourse."}]}]
author: wEarthwhie

title: DabbaDrop
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"PLANT-BASED PLANET-MINDED TAKEAWAY! Dabba Drop deliver tasty, healthy dinners to your door in reusable dabba boxes."}]}]
author: DabbaDrop

title: Lauren MacCallum and Protect Our Winters UK are working to protect the Cairngorms from global heating
content: Read more about the snowboarder working to save the mountains and community in the Scottish Highlands from climate change in our Features section.
author: story by Sam Haddad

title: Wildfires in Poland's largest national park
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Because of the terrible drought, some farmers' wrecklessness and, partly, Polish government's ignorance of the climate crisis, the Biebrza National Park in my home country of Poland is being devoured by flames right now. The firefighters have been struggling for days, but the fire keeps spreading. Of course, because of the COVID-19 outbreak, the story is somewhere in the background, pushed aside."}]}]
address: Biebrza National Park, north-eastern Poland, vicinity of Kapice, 19-200 Poland
author: Dawid Tysowski

title: Catherine Bohne is leading the fight to keep hydropower off the wild Valbona River.
content: Read more about the plan to construct 14 hydropower plants along a stretch of river, and the response of The Organisation to Conserve the Albanian Alps (TOKA), in our Features section.
author: story by Ashley Parsons

title: Logging in the protected Ebo Forest
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"There are concerns about the survival of gorillas, chimpanzees and other wildlife in the Ebo Forest. The Cameroon government is planning to licence logging in the protected forest. (via Born Free)."}]}]
author: Anonymous

title: #ReturnToOffender campaign goes digital
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Surfers Against Sewage's #ReturnToOffender campaign goes digital to track plastic pollution in Britain's public spaces and on beaches, and challenges manufacturers to do more to protect the environment. Following the tag line - See it, Snap it, Share it - and whilst adhering to social distancing guidelines, individuals are encouraged to photograph branded plastic pollution during isolated walks. The images will then be shared on social media, using the hashtags; #ReturnToOffender and #SurfersAgainstSewage. The brands/manufacturers should be tagged to urge them not to abandon action on the plastic pollution crisis. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"More information can be found at: https://www.sas.org.uk/news/the-digital-clean-up-together-we-target-worst-offending-plastic-polluting-brands-on-earth-day/"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":""}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":""}]}]
author: Lucy

title: Game to help teach kids understand the importance of being eco-friendly
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Eco Warrior is an educational game teaching children (age 5-12) how to take care of the planet, their home and belongings. Our engaging rhymes and colourful illustrations will delight the children and motivate them to help around the home and learn new habits that fight climate change."}]}]
author: Jenna

title: The All Good Activism: a group of West African sailors concerned about the environment.
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The All Good Activism is a group of young West African sailors who are particularly concerned about the environment and the ocean. The group takes initiatives and actions to reduce pollution in any port they dock in. The group engages any ship and the port authorities to follow its examples."}]}]
author: Patrice Assiongbon Sowanou

title: Online screening: Carbon and Captivity by Oliver Ressler
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Oliver Ressler's new film Carbon and Captivity is online from April 16 through May 31, 2020. The screening is presented by Entrée (est. 2009), \"an independent, non-profit gallery in Bergen, Norway, devoted to the commissioning and production of new work by local and international artists.\" "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Ressler (b.1970, Austria), \"a filmmaker and artist based in Vienna, who works on issues such as economics, democracy, global warming, forms of resistance, and social alternatives\" has completed 34 films. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The upcoming remote screening will tackle the issue of Carbon capture and storage (CCS) technology. In their curatorial statement, e-Flux Video and Film stated, \"The oil and gas should be left in the ground and a fully funded transition to a post-oil economy begun immediately, but the large-scale introduction of CCS would delay the necessary decarbonization, deepening our dependence on the fossil fuel industry. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The film’s title refers to humanity’s “captivity” within the logic of capitalism, which seems to carry extractivism onward to the point of no return.\""}]}]
author: Matt

title: Seed Paper India
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Flower growers are distressed seeing their blooms going waste due to the impact of COVID-19. Bengaluru-based, Seed Paper India, that manufactures organic handmade paper is helping by manufacturing flower embedded handmade paper to help the flower industry. The idea is to mix various kinds of flower petals into the waste cotton cloth-pulp used to make the paper. Flower petal note books, diaries, book marks, letter pads, calendars, visiting cards, souvenirs and mementos will be created and part of the proceeds of this endeavour will go to the farmers."}]}]
address: 204, Navaratna Manor, 37/1 Subbarama Chetty Road, Basavanagudi
author: BINDU

title: 27/04: Live webinar with Rupert Read and Helena Norberg-Hodge
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Helena Norberg-Hodge, a leading environmentalist and local economy pioneer, and Robert Read, Chair of the Green House think tank, discuss 'Tackling the climate crisis: shifting from global to local in the context of COVID-19.' Sign up here – "},{"type":"link","url":"https://www.localfutures.org/events-calendar/upcoming-events/april-27th-2020-helena-norberg-hodge-rupert-read-webinar/","children":[{"text":"https://www.localfutures.org/events-calendar/upcoming-events/april-27th-2020-helena-norberg-hodge-rupert-read-webinar/"}]},{"text":""}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"UK: 10:00-11:30 am"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"India : 2:30-4:00 pm"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"South Korea: 6:00-7:30 pm"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Byron Bay, Australia: 7:00-8:30 pm"}]}]
author: Anonymous

title: Clothes sharing app launches to combat sustainability issue in fashion industry
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The Nu Wardrobe was founded by Irish native Aisling Byrne in an attempt to combat the huge sustainability issues within the fashion industry. Creating a social network for women to share clothes within their local community, the platform pledges to offer unlimited fashion without destroying the planet. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Visit "},{"type":"link","url":"https://www.thenuwardrobe.com","children":[{"text":"https://www.thenuwardrobe.com"}]},{"text":" for more info and listen to Aisling tell the founding story on "},{"type":"link","url":"https://anchor.fm/whatitslikewithluce/episodes/What-Its-Like----to-be-Aisling-Byrne-eb675i","children":[{"text":"https://anchor.fm/whatitslikewithluce/episodes/What-Its-Like----to-be-Aisling-Byrne-eb675i"}]},{"text":" "}]}]
author: Lucy Carol Norris

title: Thriftify launches in Ireland to virtually connect charity shops with consumers
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The act of purchasing ethically and sustainably - thriftify is the platform creating a movement of positive purchasing by connecting charity shops with consumers who care. Selling everything from books, to vinyl and clothing, this online market place is leading the sustainability / second hand movement in Ireland. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Find out more by visiting "},{"type":"link","url":"https://www.thriftify.ie/our-manifesto.html/","children":[{"text":"https://www.thriftify.ie/our-manifesto.html/"}]},{"text":" "}]}]
address: Ballyfermot Community Civic Centre, Dublin 10, Ireland
author: Lucy Carol Norris

title: Closet19 launches
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":""},{"type":"link","url":"https://closet-19.sharetribe.com/","children":[{"text":"Closet19"}]},{"text":" is a not-for-profit online clothes marketplace supporting the NHS and challenging fast fashion. "}]}]
author: Anonymous

title: HS2 construction pushes ahead despite national lockdown
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Since the construction of the HS2 railway line began, there have been countless ecosystems irreparably damaged and habitats destroyed, with many vital environments still at risk of destruction. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The Warwickshire Wildlife Trust highlighted that across the area of Warwickshire, \"over 8.1 hectares of ancient woodland will be lost\" ("},{"type":"link","url":"https://www.warwickshirewildlifetrust.org.uk/saving-wildlife-and-wild-places/hs2-warwickshire-our-position-hs2","children":[{"text":"https://www.warwickshirewildlifetrust.org.uk/saving-wildlife-and-wild-places/hs2-warwickshire-our-position-hs2"}]},{"text":") as a result of the line. Protests against the line have continued since the beginning of the project, but have remained largely unheard by those in power. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Alongside the inevitable environmental destruction, calls for construction to cease are also economically based as the project has far exceeded its original budget. Despite this, Boris Johnson gave them the green light to continue even in the face of the national lockdown ("},{"type":"link","url":"https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-52293055","children":[{"text":"https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-52293055"}]},{"text":"). "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Countless more wildlife, green spaces and ecosystems will suffer as a result of the HS2 line and undoubtedly, protests to protect the natural world that is being destroyed will continue. "}]}]
address: Warwickshire - CV32 7UH (South Cubbington Woods, one of the sites affected)
author: Sadia Nowshin

title: Pollution levels remain high in Poland due to reliance on coal
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Read the "},{"type":"link","url":"https://www.ourstosave.com/feature?id=ck9o59ui3002z0743cdv0xsii","children":[{"text":"full article"}]},{"text":" in Ours to Save's Features section. "}]}]
author: story by Juliette

title: Zero-Waste Supermarket
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Food supply lines are all under stress at the moment with the corona virus affecting all walks of life. Yet the Eco Larder, with their locally-sourced, reasonably-priced, and organic produce, have managed to stay open and offer bike deliveries to those who are in self-isolation or who cannot reach their store. They are zero-waste and their local supply chains mean that there has been little interruption to their service, a godsend to Edinburgh residents during the pandemic."}]}]
author: Rachael Davies

title: Clubtopia launch competition for ideas to create a greener club culture
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"In Berlin, a city well known for it's club culture, the organisation Clubtopia is fighting for more a sustainable nightlife scence. Although the clubs are closed due to the pandemic, they're currently running a competition and collecting ideas on how to achieve their aforementioned goal. Winners will receive support in helping to realise their ideas."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"More info can be found here, though the website is in German: "},{"type":"link","url":"https://clubtopia.de/blogbeitrag/future-party-ideenwettbewerb/","children":[{"text":"https://clubtopia.de/blogbeitrag/future-party-ideenwettbewerb/"}]},{"text":"."}]}]
author: Anonymous

title: Healers in Chhattisgarh are struggling against legal and environmental challenges
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Read the "},{"type":"link","url":"https://www.ourstosave.com/feature?id=ck9tyubin000f07034ndk4kqj","children":[{"text":"full article"}]},{"text":" in Ours to Save's Features section. "}]}]
author: Ankita Anand

title: Green Anchor makes condiment range from food waste
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Green Anchor rescues surplus ingredients that are overlooked and normally go to waste and turns them into delicious condiments and food.  Ugly, wrong shape, wrong size tomatoes make the Tomato & Tasmanian pepperberry relish, while Broccoli stalks are turned into a pickle/gherkin!  Founded by UK born chef James Wallis. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"www.greenanchor.com.au"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Not only does Green Anchor fight food waste with delicious food, but every time you choose to buy a product they plant a tree with Trees For The Future www.trees.org to help close the loop and fight climate change"}]}]
author: James

title: The Greentech Alliance launches
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Though the founding members ar located in Berlin, the Greentech Alliance is an international organisation aimed at connecting those who are building technologies to create a more sustainable future. Their aim is to create networking and new business opportunities for members, in addition to sharing informaton on sources of funding. More info can be found at: "},{"type":"link","url":"https://www.greentech.earth","children":[{"text":"https://www.greentech.earth"}]},{"text":"."}]}]
author: Jack McGovan

title: The Local Electricity Bill will be debated in parliament in late May
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The Local Electricity Bill signals new hope for sourcing renewable energy locally. Read the"},{"type":"link","url":"https://www.ourstosave.com/feature?id=ck9uebczu00ct070385ivo6bf","children":[{"text":" full article "}]},{"text":"in our Features section. "}]}]
author: Florence

title: Langholm Moor Community Buyout
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"LANGHOLM MOOR: COMMUNITY BUYOUT"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Supporting the south of Scotlands largest community land purchase. To manage Langholm Moor for ecological restoration and community regeneration."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The Langholm Initiative have launched their crowdfunding campaign as they attempt the largest community buyout in the south of Scotland, hoping to bring 10,500 acres (about 5,600 football pitches) into community ownership. To be successful we need to raise the full purchase price by the end of October 2020."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":""},{"type":"link","url":"https://www.gofundme.com/f/langholm-moor-buyout","children":[{"text":"https://www.gofundme.com/f/langholm-moor-buyout"}]},{"text":""}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":""},{"type":"link","url":"https://www.gofundme.com/f/langholm-moor-buyout","children":[{"text":""}]},{"text":""}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The project has received a great boost today (07/05/2020)  as the John Muir Trust has pledged £100,000 towards the purchase."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"This project has the potential to act as a blueprint for other communities to place the environment at the heart of the decisions they make."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The project has received widespread support from organisations such as the John Muir Trust, RSPB Scotland, The Woodland Trust, Borders Forest Trust and The Revive Coalition. In addition to this we have cross party political support for our plans, due to the positive goals relating to climate change, ecological restoration and community regeneration."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Locally over 20 organisations have written letters of support for the buyout."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Kevin Cumming, the Langholm Initiative’s project leader said: “Our community plans here have international significance. At a time of climate emergency we are committing to undertake direct climate action including peatland restoration, ancient woodland restoration, the creation of new native woodlands and increasing the diversity of wildlife here”"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"“At this critical stage we are asking for the help of the public. We know it is a lot to ask at a time like this but if people can support us by donating to this project we will be demonstrating a more positive future for our children.”"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"These ambitious plans will be taken forward with the creation of the new Tarras Valley Nature Reserve."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Our plans"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Over the past six months, a thorough feasibility study has been conducted by community land specialists Duncan MacPherson, Faye McLeod  & Willie McGhee, (a huge thank you to previous crowdfunding supporters for making this possible)."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"This has given us a vision for a bright future for Langholm moor,  a sustainable business plan for the  Langholm Initiative, and demonstrated real community and environmental benefits.  Our plans centre around creating the Tarras Valley Nature Reserve on the vast majority of the land. Here we will carry out positive climate action and provide a new focus for wildlife tourism and recreation in the south of Scotland.  On a smaller area of land nearest the town itself we will investigate appropriate small scale renewable energy (a single small turbine and a single small solar farm) and the development of a small eco-campsite. We will also investigate repurposing disused and dilapidated steadings for either small scale housing or modern business units, both of which are badly needed in Langholm (there have only been 6 new houses built in Langholm in the past 30 years)."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"This land also holds huge historical and cultural significance to local people who care passionately about its future. For over 250 years the community have marked the boundaries of the common land and this tradition still goes on today with the annual Common Riding celebration."}]}]
author: Kevin Cumming

title: Reverse Garbage saves 60 tonnes of resources from landfill each  year
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Reverse Garbage is a not-for-profit creative reuse centre  in Sydney’s inner west. Each year we redirect around 250 tonnes of commercial and industrial waste from landfill to a new life with educators, artists, upcyclers, DIY enthusiasts, tinkerers, set builders, window dressers, community organisations, festivals, charities, and more."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"We were established in 1974 by a group of teachers, and to this day, education is a major focus for our reuse resources. Our workshops in schools and at community events reach take the reuse messaging to 16,000 people each year."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":""}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"To find out more, please visit www.reversegarbage.org.au or follow us on Facebook or Instagram. "}]}]
address: Hut 8, 142 Addison Road, Marrickville NSW 2204 Australia
author: Reverse Garbage

title: Plan A and Green City Solutions team up for a greener future
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"We are thrilled to announce that Green City Solutions GmbH is joining our platform to start their journey to sustainability. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":""}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Green City Solutions’ mission is to create urban living spaces where people can live healthier. They have designed a moss powered air filter that they have over the past five years installed in cities across Europe. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":""}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Green City Solutions are taking their sustainable commitment further with Plan A by calculating, monitoring and reducing their CO2 emissions. Follow their journey to get inspired and trail your own sustainable path. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":""}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"www.plana.earth and www.greencitysolutions.de"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":""}]}]

author: Harry Kingdon

title: New climate activist group DecarboniseNow lobbies for earlier phase out of petrol and diesel cars
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"A new volunteer run climate campaign group called DecarboniseNow is pushing the UK government to act on five key areas: electric vehicles, renewables, warmer buildings, efficient manufacturing and afforestation. DecarboniseNow is designed to allow campaigners to engage with specific climate policies directly, like an open source think and do tank. It’s currently encouraging the public to write in to the government consultation on bringing forward the conventional vehicle sales ban to 2030,  engaging more volunteers, and working on a variety of government consultations."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"They can be found here: https://decarbonisenow.com/ "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":""}]}]
address: UK wide and internet based. (Member activity from Winchester): SO23 8TJ
author: Chris Friedler

title: 'Ultra-rare' blue bees seen for the first time in years
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Researchers in Florida have rediscovered the blue calamintha bee - that they feared may have gone extinct. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"“It’s one thing to read about habitat loss and development and another to be driving for 30-40 minutes through miles of orange groves just to get to a really small conservation site,” Chase Kimmel, of the Florida Museum of Natural History, said. “It puts into perspective how much habitat loss affects all the animals that live in this area.”"}]}]
author: via Yahoo News

title: Seaside Scavenge: turning trash into cash
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Founded in New South Wales, Australia, this non-profit organisation hosts \"Spring into Scavenge\" events where people gather litter from beaches and receive tokens in exchange. These tokens can then be used to \"purchase\" clothes or other preloved items that have been donated by the community, or items donated by local businesses such as beer, ice-cream or coffee. The program was piloted in 7 communities around the world, including Australia, the UK and South Africa. In 2019, \"Roughly 500 Scavengers were activated to remove 630kg of trash and 5,000+ butts in just ONE month.\" More events will be hosted in 2020."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":""},{"type":"link","url":"https://www.seasidescavenge.org/programs","children":[{"text":"https://www.seasidescavenge.org/programs"}]},{"text":""}]}]
author: Anna

title: Heat-tolerant algae: the race to find short-term solutions to coral bleaching
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Scientists in Australia have developed heat-tolerant algae in labs. Through these experiments they have been able to save coral larvae from bleaching (still only in lab though). The hope is that this will provide a short(er)-term  solution to the mass coral bleaching that continues to destroy coral reefs at an unprecedented rate "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":""}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":""},{"type":"link","url":"https://www.csiro.au/en/News/News-releases/2020/Scientists-successfully-develop-heat-resistant-coral-to-fight-bleaching","children":[{"text":"https://www.csiro.au/en/News/News-releases/2020/Scientists-successfully-develop-heat-resistant-coral-to-fight-bleaching"}]},{"text":""}]}]
author: Esmé Audland

title: Using agroforestry to address climate change and land degradation
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"In Malakisi, Western Kenya, smallholder farmers have implemented sustainable agricultural land management practices, to restore their degraded lands to productivity. They are also earning money by selling carbon credits which has enabled them to start income generating projects that are helping lower poverty levels there. "},{"type":"link","url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IAEBoTqLEZ0","children":[{"text":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IAEBoTqLEZ0"}]},{"text":""}]}]
author: James Karuga

title: Rain water harvesting to adapt to climate change
content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"This story shows how smallholder farmers in Machakos County, are adapting to effects of reduced rains due to climate change and land degradation, through water harvesting, tree planting, and agro-forestry. This video illustrates how farmers can continue on farming even in times of climate change. "},{"type":"link","url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kEmkD0_m4zc","children":[{"text":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kEmkD0_m4zc"}]},{"text":""}]}]
author: James Karuga
